intro: Dracocephalum truncatum, commonly known as narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, blue-violet flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments. Dracocephalum truncatum is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial properties.
